bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FORBES:H.R. 635.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 1 and Section 8, Clause 18.[Page H683]

item.name: Technology, Information Policy, Intergovernmental Relations and Procurement Reform Subcommittee
Technology, Information Policy, Intergovernmental Relations and Procurement Reform Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Technology, Information Policy, Intergovernmental Relations and Procurement Reform .
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

summary.text: Parental Title Protection Act of 2011 - Requires federal agencies, contractors, or government-sponsored enterprises to use the words "mother" and "father" when describing parents, and not the words "parent 1" or "parent 2" (or similar words), in all official documents issued by such entities.

bill.title: Parental Title Protection Act of 2011

item.title: To require that all Federal agencies, contractors, and government-sponsored enterprises use the words "mother" and "father" when describing parents in all official documents and forms.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Technology, Information Policy, Intergovernmental Relations and Procurement Reform .

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
